who happened to see a robbery.

base.

items.title: NRA president says assault weapon ban will not pass
items.htmlTitle: NRA president says assault weapon ban will not pass
items.snippet:
Vice President Joe Biden is wrapping up his gun reform task force and plans to 
deliver the findings to President Obama next week. The NRA says an assault 
weapons ban is not going to become a reality. Mark Glaze of Mayors Against 
Illegal Guns joins Ed Schultz to explain whether the NRA's prediction will come 
true.

true.

items.snippet:
Jul 13, 2015 ... If you want to bring a gun into a Whataburger, you better keep it out of sight. The 
iconic Texas fast-food chain recently announced that it will not allow customers to 
openly carry firearms in its restaurants, despite a new law that empowers Texans 
to display their guns while walking the state's streets.

items.title: Inside the 2016 NRA convention | MSNBC
items.htmlTitle: Inside the 2016 NRA convention | MSNBC
items.snippet:
May 22, 2016 ... This May, Louisville, Kentucky played host to the National Rifle Association 
convention — an annual meeting of pistols and politics that this year boasted a 
500,000 square foot firearms display. The convention, conceived by the Union 
officers who founded the NRA after the Civil War, is in its 145th year.

items.title: White House: 'Varying confidence' of chemical weapon use in Syria

amounts" of chemical weapons in Syria. Now the question is: what will the US do 
next? MSNBC's Lawrence O'Donnell and Mother Jones' David Corn discuss the 
White House's measured and prudent response to this new information.

items.title: Inside the 2016 NRA convention | MSNBC
items.htmlTitle: Inside the 2016 NRA convention | MSNBC
items.snippet:
May 22, 2016 ... This May, Louisville, Kentucky played host to the National Rifle Association 
convention — an annual meeting of pistols and politics that this year boasted a 
500,000 square foot firearms display. The convention, conceived by the Union 
officers who founded the NRA after the Civil War, is in its 145th year.

items.snippet:
Feb 15, 2018 ... Rachel Maddow points out that the first significant piece of legislation Donald 
Trump signed was to give mentally ill people easier access to guns, so his 
concern that the Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School shooter was mentally ill 
and shouldn't have been allowed a gun doesn't carry much weight.

amounts" of chemical weapons in Syria. Now the question is: what will the US do 
next? MSNBC's Lawrence O'Donnell and Mother Jones' David Corn discuss the 
White House's measured and prudent response to this new information.

items.title: Inside the 2016 NRA convention | MSNBC
items.htmlTitle: Inside the 2016 NRA convention | MSNBC
items.snippet:
May 22, 2016 ... This May, Louisville, Kentucky played host to the National Rifle Association 
convention — an annual meeting of pistols and politics that this year boasted a 
500,000 square foot firearms display. The convention, conceived by the Union 
officers who founded the NRA after the Civil War, is in its 145th year.

items.snippet:

convention. […] NRA boss Wayne LaPierre has called repeatedly for allowing 
guns in schools, and other facilities. LaPierre says arming teachers and guards 
will help prevent gun violence. At least, outside the NRA's own events.

items.title: Trump words on gun tragedy ring hollow given past legislation
items.htmlTitle: Trump words on gun tragedy ring hollow given past legislation
items.snippet:
Feb 15, 2018 ... Rachel Maddow points out that the first significant piece of legislation Donald 
Trump signed was to give mentally ill people easier access to guns, so his 
concern that the Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School shooter was mentally ill 
and shouldn't have been allowed a gun doesn't carry much weight.

to display their guns while walking the state's streets.

items.title: Inside the 2016 NRA convention | MSNBC
items.htmlTitle: Inside the 2016 NRA convention | MSNBC
items.snippet:
May 22, 2016 ... This May, Louisville, Kentucky played host to the National Rifle Association 
convention — an annual meeting of pistols and politics that this year boasted a 
500,000 square foot firearms display. The convention, conceived by the Union 
officers who founded the NRA after the Civil War, is in its 145th year.

officers who founded the NRA after the Civil War, is in its 145th year.

concern that the Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School shooter was mentally ill 
and shouldn't have been allowed a gun doesn't carry much weight.

to display their guns while walking the state's streets.

items.snippet:

amounts" of chemical weapons in Syria. Now the question is: what will the US do 
next? MSNBC's Lawrence O'Donnell and Mother Jones' David Corn discuss the 
White House's measured and prudent response to this new information.

items.title: Inside the 2016 NRA convention | MSNBC
items.htmlTitle: Inside the 2016 NRA convention | MSNBC
items.snippet:
May 22, 2016 ... This May, Louisville, Kentucky played host to the National Rifle Association 
convention — an annual meeting of pistols and politics that this year boasted a 
500,000 square foot firearms display. The convention, conceived by the Union 
officers who founded the NRA after the Civil War, is in its 145th year.

items.title: Inside the 2016 NRA convention | MSNBC
items.htmlTitle: Inside the 2016 NRA convention | MSNBC
items.snippet:
May 22, 2016 ... This May, Louisville, Kentucky played host to the National Rifle Association 
convention — an annual meeting of pistols and politics that this year boasted a 
500,000 square foot firearms display. The convention, conceived by the Union 
officers who founded the NRA after the Civil War, is in its 145th year.

concern that the Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School shooter was mentally ill 
and shouldn't have been allowed a gun doesn't carry much weight.

metatags.og:title: Connecticut Senator: Get assault weapons off the streets
metatags.og:description: Sen. Chris Murphy, who was in office when the Sandy Hook Elementary school mass shooting took place, spoke to Katy about the challenges of changing gun laws. He says the difference between the US and other countries is that this country allows people with mental illness to spiral into taking an assault weapon into a school, and that Congress has to act to get those weapons off the street. He added that measures that Connecticut has taken have reduced their gun homicides by 40%.

metatags.og:description: Sen. Chris Murphy, who was in office when the Sandy Hook Elementary school mass shooting took place, spoke to Katy about the challenges of changing gun laws. He says the difference between the US and other countries is that this country allows people with mental illness to spiral into taking an assault weapon into a school, and that Congress has to act to get those weapons off the street. He added that measures that Connecticut has taken have reduced their gun homicides by 40%.
